prompt:
Job Category Level One: AI & Machine Learning
Job Category Level Two: Data Science & Analytics
Description: We are a labor hire company that specializes in sourcing construction and warehouse workers to meet the specific job requirements of our clients.

to increase efficiency, we are seeking the services of an AI specialist to make our business smarter

Firstly, we need an automated allocation system that utilizes AI technology to recommend suitable workers from our database based on the job orders we receive. This allocation system should take into account various factors such as location and other relevant parameters to optimize the allocation process.

Secondly, we require an AI-powered bot to communicate with the selected workers via WhatsApp or SMS. This bot will be responsible for checking the availability and interest of the selected worker, as well as onboarding them into our company before deployment.
Linking with bubble is ideal.

prompt:
Job Category Level One: AI & Machine Learning
Job Category Level Two: Data Science & Analytics
Description:  Please read our project description in detail before applying for this project.

We currently have a need for someone to help us use the ChatGPT API to develop medical content that is unique, accurate and follows our specific requirements.

Project Scope: We are looking to develop detailed reports on 300 different diseases. Each report will be between 30,000 words and is broken down into 62 sections. These 62 sections will be the same across the 300 different diseases. For example, symptoms, treatment options, etc.

Hurdles we have encountered: So far when we used Chat GPT 4 manually, we ran accross a few issues. As part of your bid, please tell us if these issues can be resolved using the API or some other method you can intergrate in to the script you will develop for us:

1) Our prompts are so detailed for each of the 62 sections that we often would hit the character limit on the web interface. Even when we told Chat GPT that we would submit our prompts as multiple submissions, it would start to ignore the multiple prompts and start providing the response prematurely.

2) While we do have API access, we don't have access to the web browsing apps. However, for some sections we need Chat GPT to analyze web content, for example, Amazon product pages or Google Scholar results for medical research. Would there be a way for us to get Chat GPT to carry out real-time web browsing analysis?

3) We have already done content on many diseases so in some ways, we have perfect examples of how we would like Chat GPT to deliver the content in each of the 62 sections for each disease. Is there a way for us to train the Chat GPT language model on our own data so that it knows how the content should flow, its tone, etc?

4) A lot of sections are meant to be written based on the content developed for a previous section. In other words, for some sections, we want Chat GPT to take the content output of a previously generated section content and then do a new analysis/writeup based on specific requirements. Will the API allow us to use a piece of content we developed and give it to Chat GPT to use it as preliminary content to base a new writeup on?

The interface we want: Here is how we envision the interface you will be creating and the functionality that will go with it:

1) There should be an Admin login where we can securely access the interface (we only plan on having 1 user)

2) Once logged in, Admin should be able to create a new "Project" which is basically one of the 300 diseases. Admin should also be able to view other projects that have already been created.

3) Once a project is created, Admin should be able to add sections that the content should have. 

- For each section, Admin should be able to provide detailed requirements on tone, length, any content points that must be included. 

- Admin should also be able to provide examples of that section done for other diseases so that Chat GPT knows exactly how the content should be written. 

- Admin should also be able tell Chat GPT to use the content generated for another previous section to do the writeup for the current section

4) When Admin is done creating all sections and has provided detailed requirements for each section, there should be a "Generate Content" button that starts the content generation process. The content should be posted by each section.

5) Admin should be able to then further improve the content for each section by providing feedback for that particular section and then have the option to either have the content for the section rewritten or the entire document rewritten with the new feedback in mind. 

-------
Since this is going to be an ongoing, longterm project, please be detailed with your bid to let us know the following:

- How long you anticipate the project to take to launch?

- How do you anticipate addressing the 4 hurdles we encountered with the web version of Chat GPT?

- Why you would be a good fit for this particular project?

Thank you in advance for taking your time to consider this job.
Engagement: 3 to 6 months

###
completion:
Hello Daniel, this project is a perfect fit!

I’m a veteran software engineer of over 16 years with extensive experience building fully scalable and custom web and mobile apps, including AI-integrated software development solutions. prompt:
Job Category Level One: Web Development
Job Category Level Two: Web, Mobile & Software Dev
Description: I am looking for a talented Developer or Agency to create a Web App for my Amazon FBA Prep Center Warehouse. This app will be used for my clients, customers, and users to create purchase orders, track their shipments to my warehouse, as well as a admin area for my team to track our orders for everyone as well. 

Must be experienced in: Amazon Web Services (AWS) and Amazon API

Must be available for updates and additions after web app is complete - long term.

Please send your estimated time frame and estimated cost for this entire app with full functionalities, as well as any similar experience or work you have to provide.

Below is a detailed scope of the Web App and its features:

Main Features:
- User Registration: User has access to their own personalized dashboard
- Store Sync Connections: Users can connect their Amazon or Walmart marketplace store for inventory sync and management. 

Customer Portal ———
Dashboard Tab:
- Total Revenue and Sales for Past 7 Days, 30 Days, 6 Months, 1 Year and All Time for All Synced Stores (Default on All Time) 
- Live Charts of total Inventory showing the Amount of Units (“In Transit”, “Arrived at Prep Center”, “Problem With Order” , “Sent To Amazon”) so users can track the inventory they send to my warehouse

Order Tab: 
User will Enter Content Details of their shipment being sent to my warehouse and create an “order”. 
- Form Details: Ability for Attaching a Single ASIN or Multiple ASINS to order. For every product attached to order user will be able to enter QTY of Item being sent,  and Bundle quantity (if any), as well as Source Cost (this source cost will help determine profits for our reports page). 
- After entering all details of shipment app will calculate the fees for all the items being prepped. (I will provide a fee chart) and Show Estimated Fees, Show Warehouse Address to Send Products to, Order Review and Submit Button creating a New “Order” , taking user to confirmation page.
- Ability to upload CSV file for easier ordering for bulk orders (can have template on google sheet)

Inventory Tab:
- This module syncs and shows the current live inventory on the users marketplace showing the listings of items (with photo), ASIN, SKU, live inventory quantity, and low stock warnings.

Tracking Tab
- This Module will show New Orders, and Past Orders Detailed Info. Showing Order Number, Order Date, Status of Order, Charge Status (Paid/Unpaid), Quantity of Items in Shipment, Tracking Number AND Status of Order Options: (“In Transit”, “Arrived at Prep Center”, “Problem With Order” , “Sent To Amazon”)

Analytics Tab
- See Sales Analytics of Total Revenue, Profit and Refunds of an account. The Revenue and Profit will be calculated including the Prep Center Fees. App will pull total sale price and refund info from Amazon API. As mentioned, User will be able to enter the “source cost of product/investment” when creating an order. This data, along with the Amazon data, will calculate the total investment, revenue and profit made by the seller per order. If a return occurs, the app will calculate it as negative profit. + Also with feature to see individual sales report by specific ASIN. User will also be able to separate Amazon and Walmart Marketplaces with separate analytics, or the option to see them together.

Support Tab
- Submit a Request (will use a basic fluent form)

Admin Only Tools ————

- Order Management Tab: Dashboard to see all open orders, clients names attached to order, closed orders, there dates of creation, their current status, and their charge status (paid/unpaid). Ability to edit , and choose, order options with respective changes showing on clients individual accounts: Status of Order, Charge Status (Paid or Unpaid), Quantity of Items in Shipment, Tracking Number, Problem with Order Option, Archive Option and Delete Order Option and add notes to the order. (Status of Order Options: “In Transit”, “Arrived at Prep Center”, “Problem With Order” , “Sent to Amazon”) 
- Admin Analytics Tab: Dashboard to see total sales revenue of ALL stores on our platform, as well as each stores separate sales revenue.
- Client Admin Tab: Dashboard to Edit, Add or Delete Clients on to the platform
Engagement: 3 to 6 months

completion:

prompt:
Job Category Level One: DevOps & Solution Architecture
Job Category Level Two: IT & Networking
Description: *Looking for long term contractors*

SUMMARY

iFIT is a globally recognized health and fitness technology organization that caters to millions of members in 120 countries. Our mission is to empower people to lead a healthy and sustainable lifestyle through innovative fitness solutions. We constantly strive to push the boundaries by delivering engaging products that enhance the quality of our members' lives.

As a DevOps engineer at iFIT, you will be an integral part of our team that manages the systems and infrastructure supporting our connected fitness experience. You will work closely with our Platform engineering teams to develop new systems and solutions. We understand the value of a distributed team and offer remote-friendly work arrangements. Our team thrives on calculated risk-taking in the pursuit of innovation.

We are seeking a talented and motivated DevOps engineer with a proven track record of building and maintaining AWS cloud infrastructure for distributed systems. The ideal candidate is a skilled problem solver with a passion for developing sustainable systems. If you are excited about the prospect of working with innovative products and a dynamic team, we invite you to apply.


RESPONSIBILITIES

* Build and maintain reliable, scalable, cost efficient and observable infrastructure using infrastructure as code tooling such as Terraform, CloudFormation and AWS CDK
* Design and implement CI/CD pipelines
* Provide application build and deployment lifecycle support
* Provide architectural and engineering support to Platform engineering teams
* Participate in 24x7 on-call support on a weekly rotation with DevOps team members
* Manage operational incidents from detection to resolution, with follow-up postmortem reporting and action items
* Author system documentation and incident response runbooks
* Evangelize sustainable operational principles and practices
* Deliver technical trainings to DevOps and Platform teams, promoting knowledge-sharing and upleveling skill sets
* Attend team meetings over Zoom/Google Meet

REQUIRED SKILLS AND QUALIFICATIONS

* Extensive experience building cloud infrastructure using IaC tools such as Terraform, CloudFormation or AWS CDK
* Strong written and verbal communication skills in the English language
* Experience working with containers and container orchestration tools such as Amazon ECS or Kubernetes
* Proficiency in at least one programming language
* Fundamentals of CI/CD
* Comfortable with being on video during internal meetings
* Hands-on experience performing maintenance on cloud infrastructure, such as databases, networking resources, compute and storage
* Strong time-management skills
* Willingness to learn and grow as part of a team
* Preference towards repeatable solutions and TOIL reduction

PREFERRED SKILLS AND QUALIFICATIONS

* Background in software development
* Experience with Node.js and TypeScript
* Experience with instrumentation and monitoring of web applications
* Experience with event-driven architecture design and implementation
* Experience with web frameworks such as Express or Nest
* Experience managing databases, such as MongoDB or RDS PostgreSQL
* Experience with object data modeling libraries such as mongoose or prisma
* AWS Cloud certifications
* Experience with AWS cost optimization
* Networking Skills, including VPCs, subnets, load balancers, TCP/IP, DNS, the OSI model, and network analysis tools 

If you are a skilled and motivated DevOps engineer with a passion for innovation and a desire to work with cutting-edge products, we encourage you to apply for this exciting opportunity at iFIT. prompt:
Job Category Level One: DevOps & Solution Architecture
Job Category Level Two: IT & Networking
Description: AWS Cloud Network Engineer who will be helping to architect a solution for a multi-tenant SaaS application in the healthcare industry with sensitive Protected Health Information (PHI):

- Design and implement a HIPAA-compliant network architecture on AWS that ensures the confidentiality, integrity, and availability of PHI.

- Define and implement network segmentation to separate the production, development, and testing environments, as well as individual tenant networks, to limit access to PHI to only authorized personnel.

- Set up and configure AWS Direct Connect or VPN connections to securely connect the SaaS application to the customer's on-premises infrastructure, while ensuring compliance with HIPAA regulations.

- Implement network monitoring and logging tools, such as Amazon CloudWatch and AWS CloudTrail, to monitor and audit network traffic for potential security breaches or unauthorized access to PHI.

- Establish robust security measures for network traffic, such as implementing network firewalls, intrusion detection and prevention systems, and access control lists (ACLs), to ensure that only authorized traffic is allowed to enter or leave the network.

- Ensure that all network components, including network routers, switches, load balancers, and security groups, are designed and configured for maximum performance, availability, and security, and meet industry standards and regulations.

- Collaborate with other teams, such as developers and operations, to ensure that network architecture best practices are followed and that the SaaS application is designed and deployed in a secure and compliant manner.

- Continuously monitor and evaluate the network architecture to identify areas for improvement and implement enhancements to maintain the security and compliance of the SaaS application.

---
Overall, the AWS Cloud Network Engineer would need to have extensive knowledge and experience with network security, compliance regulations, and healthcare industry standards, as well as expertise in designing and implementing network architecture on AWS that meets the unique requirements of a multi-tenant SaaS application in the healthcare industry.
Engagement: More than 6 months

prompt:
Job Category Level One: Web Development
Job Category Level Two: Web, Mobile & Software Dev
Description: I'm looking for a developer to take on a unique new job!  It's a website that solves a problem that I deal with frequently at work: determining if a given company is publicly traded or not.  It's surprisingly a pain to determine.  You have to go to Yahoo Finance, Google Finance, or ultimately, to the SEC's Edgar tool and look up the company and see if there is a record.  I bought the domain, www.isupublic.com and thought maybe a tool where you drop in the name of a company, and maybe we scrape those sites above or take some other action to determine if the company is public.  If so, it displays the ticker symbol and the exchange it trades on. Love to get your thoughts on it:-) I would use this at work!

One can go to Yahoo Finance or or something but typically you can go to here: https://www.sec.gov/edgar/searchedgar/companysearch.html, at least for US-listed companies, and search for the definitive word.  If you get a returned result, the company has had a public filing.  I'm not sure what happens if a company used to be public but was taken private since and is now private (i.e. there could be old filings that show up) or if the company is public but is in the "pink sheets"; or traded in the over the counter market (OTC) where the company may not meet the bar for the NYSE or NASDAQ, etc.  We may need to consider these edge cases.  

After the user types in the company name, maybe the tool returns a simple "Yes" or "No", the ticker symbol, and what exchange it's on ( NASDAQ or NYSE, etc.). I'm in visioning a simple UX, no clutter. Maybe a nice design for "Is U Public". A box to enter the company name, a button to execute the search and that's it. 

I'm open to suggestions from a design perspective. For example would you recommend scraping the financial sites live in a headless browser or something, or gathering up everything into a database and updating it periodically? Or maybe there are APIs to explore? Maybe not initially, but eventually we can store all of those returned searches in a Big Query DB.

OR, do we do a one time download of all public companies could be one approach. There aren't a zillion public companies. There are only about 5000 public companies in the US between the NASDAQ and NYSE. Would it be cool to build a database once and then update it each month or so? Each week to catch IPOs and delistings?

Maybe for Phase 1 it's a live scape once the user enters a company name.  Phase 2 might be storing that information in a DB, or adopting the download all companies into a DB approach.

Maybe we skip the pink sheet companies for this version. But, at the end of the day, I'm open to your suggestions!

Deliverables
1 - scope estimate after discovery
2 - detailed description of functionality, API, data pipelines, etc
3 - functioning website 
4 - recommendations for future upgrades 

Communications Approach 
- Upwork notes
- Zoom or Meet call if needed/useful
Engagement: 1 to 3 months

prompt:
Job Category Level One: Web & Mobile Design
Job Category Level Two: Web, Mobile & Software Dev
Description: Hey all potential candidates,

My name is Nick and I run a sports media company called BDGE, which has a very specific focus on fantasy football (NFL American Football). We're largely present on social media platforms (YouTube, TikTok) - easily findable if you search BDGE on them!

We currently have a website (www.bdge.co) that basically serves as our e-commerce store. I currently work with a contracted engineer who built the website over the last year or so, pretty much on a full-time basis. I don't know the framework which he used to build out the website (I can find out) but I'm pretty sure it's not common among developers. He was a bit underskilled in the area (contextual to what exactly I needed built) and I think he chose the one with the lowest learning curve/built through creative/non-conventional avenues. He was building on Heroku with DJango I believe if that helps at all? (I'm not knowledgeable in engineering so I apologize if I sound ignorant here) I'm only telling you this because he built out a lot of stuff for us and has a ton of API integrations already set up on there so if you're familiar with whichever way he was building it could save a lot of time rebuilding it.

Anyway, I basically need someone to rebuild this website in a somewhat new way, but with a much heavier emphasis on front-end and design.

A summary of the website currently:
- We sell 3 separate products on the website. Two (2) info products (which are one-time purchases) and a membership pass (which is paid monthly by the user).
- The info products simply unlock different parts of the website that are private beforehand.
- The monthly membership gets people to access to a private channel in our Discord Server (so there needs to be a link between their account on our website and Discord)

The plan for the website redesign is to combine all three of these offerings into one single monthly membership product, with the ability to upsell in the future.

The website requires a heavy amount of API Integration (from partner companies, from websites that we pull football data and statistics from, etc) so knowledge in this is an absolute must.

There are also sections of the website that are mainly blog-focused with video integration that will need to have the ability for myself to edit yearly. New players enter the NFL and we'll need new profiles on the players that enter, so new API integration will be necessary.

Future plans for the website after the foundation is built out:
1. As the owner, I need the ability to understand the interface/dashboard of our product so that he can go in and easily: Create promo codes of any level (% or fixed) at any time, Have the ability to check current customers: name, email, how long they’ve been a member for, etc. Create free memberships to give away (maybe for friends/family, maybe doing lifetime giveaways), The totality of our customer base at any given moment: how many subscribers we currently have, how many we had last month, turnover, how much revenue we made during custom time-frames (MTD, last month, last year, YTD, etc).

2. Allow our audience to play trivia games (https://bit.ly/43eND86) that we play on our TikTok, with the ability to create an account via collecting their email and play the game.

3. Integrate our merch store (Printful+Shopify) that's currently on a different URL (www.bdge.shop).

4. Link our site with ConvertKit so members are automatically uploaded to our email list

5. Ability for our audience to book consultation/calls on our website with us

6. SMS pop-up to sign up

7. Ability to upsell (merch, another tier if we expand, consulting, etc)

There's probably some more, but can talk on that later. Appreciate you taking the time to read this!
Nick

You will be asked to answer the following questions when submitting a proposal:

Do you play fantasy football? Or have any interest/passion in American football?
Please send a list of any e-commerce and/or membership websites you've built
Would you be willing to come to New York at the beginning of this project to kick things off (not mandatory to say yes)
Briefly describe your process when working with a client (communication style, weekly calls, planning vs building phase, etc).
What frameworks have you worked with?
Engagement: 3 to 6 months

prompt:

Job Category Level Two: Web, Mobile & Software Dev
Description: Nextjs web application for a discount platform/social platform

We are looking to redevelop our website, front end & back end and bring in a handful of functionalities.
In the long term we're also looking to further extend our platform and sync everything through to an app.

As a brief rundown of what we are looking to achieve:
Main Website System Requirements: Crucial to be SEO friendly with fast pagespeed times.
Content Management System: important to be very user friendly for our team to upload advice article content, discounts, and customise page designs.
Tech: To be run through AWS. Possibly using Nextjs, on React?
Membership Functionality:  login portal, to share personalised offers & info relevant to demographics we gather on sign up.
Verification functionality.
Iframe: to embed on brand partners websites, for user to claim offers, without leaving a partner's website
Discount Code Management & Creation: both unique single use codes as well as also generic discount codes, eg WELCOME10.
Chat Groups: Similar to facebook groups. wherre users can create groups, invite others and others request to join
DM users
App Development: at a later stage, this would all need to be able to sync across to an app platform.

That briefly sums up our requirements, but we are open to all suggestions, tech & systems.

We are fairly tight on timings, and they are critical for us on this project, so it would be good to know your thoughts on everything, and if things sound possible.
We would want to have a system running by mid July.

To bare in mind, as an intermediary before that point.
We would like to have some kind of a database to onboard users to our system, an early registration for the platform when it launches.
A sign up system to gather interest and collate a handful of details, so we can get user uptake as early as possible.
Engagement: 1 to 3 months

prompt:
Job Category Level One: Web Development
Job Category Level Two: Web, Mobile & Software Dev
Description: We aim to develop a robust, AI-driven ad management platform that can manage and optimize ad campaigns on multiple channels like Facebook, Instagram, Google, and YouTube. The platform will intelligently handle bid management, ad copy, split testing, and optimization using AI algorithms. It will also allow easy campaign management, replication, and integration with third-party services like Salesforce and Make.com.

Features and Functionalities:

Multi-Channel Ad Management:

Integration with Facebook, Instagram, Google Ads, and YouTube Ads APIs.
Centralized dashboard to manage and monitor ad campaigns on all channels.
Support for all ad formats and targeting options available on each channel.
AI-Driven Bid Management and Optimization:

Real-time bidding adjustments based on campaign performance and budget constraints.
AI-powered suggestions for optimal bidding strategies and budget allocation.
Automatic adjustment of bids based on day-parting, device targeting, and user demographics.
Ad Copy and Split Testing:

AI-driven ad copy generation using natural language processing (NLP) techniques.
Support for split testing multiple ad variations to identify the best-performing creatives.
Automatic optimization of ad creatives based on engagement metrics and conversion goals.
Campaign Management and Replication:

Easy duplication of existing campaigns to replicate settings and creatives.
Customizable campaign templates for quick and efficient campaign setup.
Bulk editing and management of campaigns, ad sets, and ads.
Third-Party Integrations:

Seamless integration with Salesforce for lead management and CRM functionalities.
Compatibility with Make.com for connecting with Salesforce or support for custom API integration.
Conversion tracking using Instagram and Facebook "Cards" for lead collection.
Reporting and Analytics:

Advanced reporting features with customizable dashboards, charts, and KPI tracking.
Real-time campaign performance monitoring and alerts for significant changes in metrics.
Integration with Google Analytics and other analytics tools for comprehensive data analysis.
User Access and Permissions:

Role-based access control for team members with customizable permissions.
Secure login with two-factor authentication and SSO support.
Development Approach:
We propose to leverage existing libraries, APIs, and AI frameworks to build the platform, ensuring cost-effective and efficient development. We will use the following technologies and tools:

Frontend: React/Redux for building a responsive and user-friendly interface.
Backend: Node.js/Express for server-side logic and API development.
Database: MongoDB for storing campaign data and user information.
AI Frameworks: TensorFlow, Keras, or PyTorch for implementing AI algorithms and NLP techniques.
Integrations: Facebook Marketing API, Google Ads API, YouTube Ads API, Instagram Graph API, Salesforce API, and Make.com API.
Project Milestones:

Requirement gathering and analysis (2 weeks)
Design and UI/UX development (3 weeks)
Backend development and API integrations (6 weeks)
AI-driven features implementation (4 weeks)
Testing, bug fixing, and deployment (3 weeks)
Please share your experience in AI marketing and app development, including any relevant projects or technologies you have worked with. This will help us ensure that your skills are well-suited for this project.

Feel free to suggest any additional features or improvements that you believe would enhance the platform's value for our clients.
Engagement: More than 6 months
